headline: Why AES Corporation Plunged Today
summary: The renewable-energy provider fell as the Senate budget proposal kept the phaseout of wind and solar-production tax credits.  The bill reduces the tax credit next year and then authorizes a complete phaseout by 2028, although some of the most onerous provisions were relaxed relative to the House bill.  Shares of solar and wind-power producer AES Corporation (NYSE: AES) plunged 8.2% on Tuesday after the Senate Finance Committee crafting the new budget bill released details of the proposal.

headline: AES Corporation: Senate Bill Casts A Shadow Over Data Center Excitement
summary: AES Corp.'s growth in data center partnerships is promising. Solar and wind make up 66% of AES's renewables revenue. See what the Senate's proposed bill entails.
